publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-922 Sarah Boyack: Strategic Waste Funding to the City of Edinburgh Council-That the Parliament warmly welcomes the Strategic Waste Fund allocation of Â£83 million to the City of Edinburgh Council; commends the council's plans to exceed the national target of 25% recycling and composting in Edinburgh by 2006-07; further welcomes the introduction of a city centre cardboard collection scheme and the extension of kerbside collection of garden waste, paper, glass, aluminium and steel cans to over 100,000 homes in Edinburgh; congratulates the council for its aim to increase recycling facilities for residents of the capital city, and acknowledges that new and enhanced recycling facilities will help to deliver an additional 1 million tonnes of recycled materials by 2020.
S2M-922 Strategic Waste Funding to the City of Edinburgh Council (lodged on 18 February 2004) Cathy Peattie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-922 Strategic Waste Funding to the City of Edinburgh Council (lodged on 18 February 2004) Trish Godman*
S2M-922 Strategic Waste Funding to the City of Edinburgh Council (lodged on 18 February 2004) Susan Deacon*, Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-922 Strategic Waste Funding to the City of Edinburgh Council (lodged on 18 February 2004) Christine May*
S2M-922 Strategic Waste Funding to the City of Edinburgh Council (lodged on 18 February 2004) Helen Eadie*
S2M-922 Strategic Waste Funding to the City of Edinburgh Council (lodged on 18 February 2004) Elaine Smith*
